frontend.name: React 18
frontend.description: A JavaScript library for building interactive interfaces.
frontend.purpose: Enables a smooth, dynamic step-by-step wizard without page reloads.
frontend.example: Switching from Idea step to PRD step updates only the central panel.

frontend.name: TypeScript
frontend.description: A typed version of JavaScript that catches errors before running code.
frontend.purpose: Keeps the large codebase reliable by preventing type mistakes.
frontend.example: Warns if a function expects text but receives a number.

frontend.name: Vite
frontend.description: A fast tool for running and bundling the frontend.
frontend.purpose: Improves development speed and produces optimized builds.
frontend.example: Bundles the React wizard into a fast-loading production version.

frontend.name: Tailwind CSS
frontend.description: A utility-first CSS framework with ready styling classes.
frontend.purpose: Speeds up UI development and ensures visual consistency.
frontend.example: Using classes like 'rounded-xl shadow p-4' to style a PRD card.

frontend.name: shadcn/ui
frontend.description: A set of pre-built UI components styled with Tailwind.
frontend.purpose: Provides professional UI elements without custom design work.
frontend.example: Using a Dialog component for document approval modal.

frontend.name: React Router
frontend.description: URL routing system for React applications.
frontend.purpose: Maps wizard steps to URLs for navigation and sharing.
frontend.example: Opening /wizard/qa directly loads the QA step screen.

frontend.name: TanStack Query
frontend.description: Data-fetching and caching system for React.
frontend.purpose: Keeps agent results fresh and prevents repeated API calls.
frontend.example: Caching the latest architecture file after Technical Architect runs.

frontend.name: TipTap
frontend.description: A rich-text editor framework for web apps.
frontend.purpose: Allows users to edit agent-generated documents directly in the UI.
frontend.example: Editing a PRD draft from BA Agent using formatting controls.

frontend.name: React Flow
frontend.purpose: Displays the full multi-agent workflow as a visual graph.
frontend.example: Showing nodes: PM → BA → UXD → UIA → Architect → QA → DevOps.

frontend.name: Zod
frontend.description: A schema validation library for TypeScript.
frontend.purpose: Validates wizard inputs and agent outputs before saving.
frontend.example: Rejects UX data if personas list is missing.

backend_and_data.name: Supabase Postgres
backend_and_data.purpose: Stores projects, workflows, agent runs, documents, approvals.

backend_and_data.name: Supabase Auth
backend_and_data.purpose: Separates user workspaces and protects data.
backend_and_data.example: User logs in, receives a secure user ID for all project data.

backend_and_data.name: Supabase Storage
backend_and_data.description: File storage built on object storage.
backend_and_data.purpose: Stores PDFs, DOCX, JSON documents, and ZIP exports.
backend_and_data.example: Uploading ux_spec_v3.pdf after UXD Agent finishes.

backend_and_data.name: Supabase Realtime
backend_and_data.description: Live event streaming from database changes.
backend_and_data.purpose: Updates UI instantly when an agent completes a step.

backend_and_data.name: pgvector
backend_and_data.description: A Postgres extension for storing and searching vector embeddings.
backend_and_data.purpose: Enables semantic search for agent context reuse.
backend_and_data.example: BA Agent finding similar requirements across older projects.

backend_and_data.name: Supabase Edge Functions
backend_and_data.description: Serverless backend functions written in TypeScript.
backend_and_data.purpose: Handle agent triggers, file exports, workflow logic.
backend_and_data.example: Handling /run-tech-architect to run the agent pipeline.

backend_and_data.name: Row-Level Security
backend_and_data.description: Database rules that restrict access by user.
backend_and_data.purpose: Ensures users only see their own project data.
backend_and_data.example: Project rows visible only where user_id = auth.uid().

backend_and_data.name: supabase-js
backend_and_data.description: JavaScript client for all Supabase services.
backend_and_data.purpose: Unified way for frontend and backend to access DB and files.

ai_and_orchestration.name: LangGraph JS
ai_and_orchestration.description: Graph-based orchestration engine for multi-agent workflows.
ai_and_orchestration.purpose: Defines the sequence and dependencies of PM→BA→UXD→etc.
ai_and_orchestration.example: Running UXD Agent automatically after PRD approval.

ai_and_orchestration.name: LangChain.js
ai_and_orchestration.description: Toolkit for prompts, LLM calls, retrieval, agent logic.
ai_and_orchestration.purpose: Helps agents generate structured deliverables from inputs.
ai_and_orchestration.example: BA Agent generating PRD text from idea + market insights.

ai_and_orchestration.name: Ollama (Self-hosted LLM runtime)
ai_and_orchestration.description: A local server that runs open-source models for free.
ai_and_orchestration.purpose: Provides unlimited LLM usage with no API costs.
ai_and_orchestration.example: UXD Agent generating flows using a local Llama model.

ai_and_orchestration.name: Embedding Service (Python + FastAPI)
ai_and_orchestration.description: Microservice that converts text into embeddings.
ai_and_orchestration.purpose: Enables semantic search and memory across projects.
ai_and_orchestration.example: Returning vector for 'checkout flow' and storing it in pgvector.

ai_and_orchestration.name: Parsing & Export Tools
ai_and_orchestration.description: Libraries for converting text/JSON into PDF, DOCX, markdown.
ai_and_orchestration.purpose: Allows exporting deliverables in standard formats.
ai_and_orchestration.example: Turning UX notes into a DOCX UX specification.

ai_and_orchestration.name: JSON Generation & Validation Layer
ai_and_orchestration.description: Uses LLM structured output + schema validation.
ai_and_orchestration.purpose: Ensures agent outputs follow strict JSON structures.
ai_and_orchestration.example: Validating PRD JSON to check that 'requirements' array is present.

file_deliverables.name: Supabase Storage
file_deliverables.description: File repository used for all agent-created documents.
file_deliverables.purpose: Stores PDFs, JSON files, versioned specs.
file_deliverables.example: Saving architecture_v2.json and its PDF version.

file_deliverables.name: Postgres Version Metadata
file_deliverables.description: Database tables storing file versions, comments, approvals.
file_deliverables.purpose: Tracks evolution of PRDs, UX specs, and plans.
file_deliverables.example: Creating PRD v4 while keeping v3 and v2 accessible.

file_deliverables.name: Document Diffing
file_deliverables.description: Logic to compare text or JSON between versions.
file_deliverables.purpose: Shows users what changed before they approve updates.
file_deliverables.example: Highlighting new UX nodes added by UXD Agent.

file_deliverables.name: JSON Schema / Zod Validators
file_deliverables.purpose: Prevents incomplete or invalid JSON from entering the workflow.

file_deliverables.name: Export Libraries (docx, pdf, md)
file_deliverables.description: Tools to generate different file formats for download.
file_deliverables.purpose: Enables clean exports for clients and teams.

file_deliverables.name: jszip
file_deliverables.example: Packaging PRD, UX, architecture, QA into project.zip.

file_deliverables.name: Automatic File Naming
file_deliverables.description: Standardized naming rules for generated files.
file_deliverables.purpose: Keeps storage organized across projects and versions.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: GitHub Monorepo
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Keeps frontend, backend, and agents in one place.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: A commit updates both UI and agent logic together.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Netlify
infrastructure_and_devops.description: Hosting platform for the frontend with auto deploy.
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Runs the wizard UI without manual servers.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Publishing new UI after merging a pull request.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Supabase Hosting
infrastructure_and_devops.description: Managed hosting for database, auth, storage, and functions.
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Removes need to build your own backend servers.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Running an Edge Function to trigger the Tech Architect agent.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Linux VM with Docker
infrastructure_and_devops.description: A virtual machine hosting AI services in containers.
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Runs LLM runtime, embedding service, and LangGraph securely.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Hosting an Ollama container with Llama-3 model.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Docker
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Keeps AI components isolated and easy to update.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Rebuilding only the embedding service container.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: GitHub Actions
infrastructure_and_devops.description: CI/CD pipelines for testing and deployment.
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Automates build, test, and deployment cycle.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Deploying Edge Functions after tests pass.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Sentry
infrastructure_and_devops.description: Error tracking for frontend and backend.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Catching malformed JSON returned by an agent.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: PostHog
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Shows where users drop off in the wizard.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Finding many users stop at Architecture Review.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Central Log Aggregation
infrastructure_and_devops.description: Combined logs from VM and Supabase.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Tracing DevOps Agent execution across logs.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Testing Stack
infrastructure_and_devops.description: Vitest, Playwright, Pytest for automated testing.
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Ensures stability of UI, workflows, and AI services.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Playwright simulating full user journey from idea to export.

infrastructure_and_devops.name: Code Quality Tools
infrastructure_and_devops.description: ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript strict mode.
infrastructure_and_devops.purpose: Keeps code clean and prevents subtle mistakes.
infrastructure_and_devops.example: Blocking a commit with unused variables in agent logic.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: PostHog
analytics_monitoring_quality.description: Tracks user interactions with the wizard.
analytics_monitoring_quality.purpose: Reveals UX issues and improvement areas.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: Sentry
analytics_monitoring_quality.purpose: Captures crashes in agents and backend functions.
analytics_monitoring_quality.example: Logging failures in PRD generator pipeline.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: Supabase Logs
analytics_monitoring_quality.description: Logs from database and Edge Functions.
analytics_monitoring_quality.purpose: Shows backend execution flow for debugging.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: OpenSearch / Logflare
analytics_monitoring_quality.purpose: Allows searching across all agent logs.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: Vitest
analytics_monitoring_quality.description: Unit test runner for frontend and shared logic.
analytics_monitoring_quality.purpose: Ensures components and functions behave correctly.
analytics_monitoring_quality.example: Testing validation logic for PRD step.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: Playwright
analytics_monitoring_quality.example: Simulating full run from PM Agent to deployment.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: Pytest
analytics_monitoring_quality.example: Checking embedding API returns correct vector size.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: ESLint + Prettier
analytics_monitoring_quality.purpose: Keeps code clean and reduces errors.
analytics_monitoring_quality.example: Auto-formatting code and catching unused imports.

analytics_monitoring_quality.name: TypeScript Strict Mode
analytics_monitoring_quality.purpose: Prevents incorrect data flow between agents.
analytics_monitoring_quality.example: Catching missing fields in UXD Agent inputs.
